lexUnit.name: threaten.v

corpus.description: Texts from Nuclear Threat Initiative website, created by Center for Non-Proliferation Studies
corpus.name: NTI

lexUnit.definition: COD: make or express a threat to (someone) or to do (something).

sentence.text: ` Well look for them somewhere else , will you , or I 'll tan your backside , " the man threatened , and he made a run at Henry and chased him right through the gates .
` I 'll have you run in , you varmints , " Sugden threatened .

` I should have to dock your wages , " the old man threatened .
" I 'll be back , " he threatened .
` I am never speaking to you again , " Charity threatened .

` If you ever do that again " threatened Harriet .
` Oh , Doctor , " threatened Fakrid , ` you 'd better have come up with something .
` I 'll haunt the place if she does , " threatened the old lady .

You do n't forget someone who threatens to kill you .
The greying gunman pulled the weapon out of a carrier bag and threatened to shoot a cashier unless she handed over money .
I knew that I had n't been kidding myself when he turned up one evening looking exhausted , miserable and defeated , to tell me his wife had threatened to start divorce proceedings .

Always grumbling , he had threatened them with all kinds of dreadful punishment if he had caught them walking in St Andrew 's churchyard or sheltering in the porch .

` Do you know if anybody ever threatened her in any way ? "
After his arrest he threatened officers by drawing his finger across his neck to suggest he would one day kill them .
